chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles A Schmitz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $965.00.Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED. Blood draw costs paid in full. To be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.
Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the plea colloquy from Monday. Defense is requesting the Court accept the plea as previously conducted. Defense requests to continue with the plea and sentencing entered on Monday. Court addresses reopening sentencing. Defense requests sentencing remain. State responds. Court will resentence the defendant as follows: Huber privileges are revoked. All other conditions remain as previously imposed.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles A Schmitz in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. Court orders warrant quashed. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years 4 months  (Initial Confinement: 28 months, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 3 Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel has been complied with.
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department - append to fine. 
- Fine totaling $1519 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - APPLY BAIL
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores). 
 - 1 year jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) - 2 days credit -  commencing FORTHWITH.  Non-working hours with standard release Conditions.
